text: welcome to real hola everybody from Rio
de Janeiro we're getting excited for the
Summer Olympics so we wanted to round up
all of the best things to do in Rio de
Janeiro now the most iconic thing to do
when you're in Rio de Janeiro is to
check out christ the redeemer now you
can do this either by going up and
taking a train up and seeing it or
walking up or i recommend doing a
helicopter tour this is the best way to
get the best view not only of real but
of christ the redeemer himself a very
popular stop in Rio is Sugarloaf
Mountain this is a great place to go and
watch the sunset you take a trolley car
all the way up to the top and get
amazing panoramic views now what a lot
of people don't think about when they're
in Rio is going to take a favela tour
it's a great way to learn about the
local culture and how things have
changed over the years in the favelas
1.6 million people live in favelas in a
city that only has a population of 6
million so there's a lot of people that
live here and that's a true way to
explore the culture of the city and you
can't come to Rio and not visit those
iconic beaches there's Copacabana
there's Ipanema and there's lip laws and
all of them are spectacular Rio is known
for its Samba culture every year they
have the huge Rio Carnival which is all
about Samba competition so when you're
there make sure you take some lessons
and then this is a Samba drum to see
where it all happens now a lot of people
don't really thinking about it heading
downtown Rio but it's really a special
place there's lots of things you can do
there like explore through the alleyways
check out the Museum of tomorrow which
is pretty cool well there's a bunch of
cathedrals and churches and you can even
see Carmen Miranda's house where she
lived before she became an international
star and if you're looking for a few
quiet places sort of get away from all
the hustle and bustle make sure you
check out the Parque la J and the
Botanical Gardens they are quiet oasis
in a very busy city so we highly
recommend going to them the lapis steps
are another popular spot to visit
there's this great long flight of steps
that heads up there and it's all covered
by these beautiful mosaics from around
the world they are located near Santa
Teresa which is a really cool artists
community and it offers some great
lookouts of the city as well make sure
you spend a day there and have a cafe or
two the best part of visiting Rio is
taking in all of the views of the city
there are so many high lookouts now you
can go all the way up to Christ the
Redeemer but we even felt that Dona
Marta which is only three-quarters of
the way up was one of the best it gives
you that excellent panoramic view and
you can really appreciate the beauty of
Rio de Janeiro from there and when
dining out in Rio you have to do a
Brazilian barbecue people from Brazil
love their beef and you can really eat a
lot when you're there there's great
spreads of salad bars and then they
bring your meat right to the table I'm
still full whoo I think that's all of
them those are our favorite places and
favorite things to do while you're in
real whether it be beaches or whether it
be beautiful lookouts real really has a
little bit for everybody and for more
City guides make sure you subscribe to
our Channel right in the link below new
videos every Tuesday and Thursday
